description.en: A resource that acts or has the power to act.
An organization that is legally registered
The registration is a fundamental relationship between a legal entity and the authority with which it is registered and that confers legal status upon it.
The legal name of the organisation.
Person whose information is recorded in a register.
The full name of the person, in a general a combination of the first and last name.
Identification code of the person in the register.
Consent of the Data Subject for the specified Processing of their Personal Data.

usage.en: REMARK: The name of this class does not imply that Consent has been given or is valid. This  depends on the value of attributes like hasConsentStatus and others.

description.en: TODO
Entity that is responsible for this stage of the Consent.

usage.en: Eg the Data Controller if the status is Consent Requested or the Data Subject for a Consent Given. To be updated when the Consent Status changes. REMARK: Required in case of Consent by delegation, such as in the case of a parent or a guardian responsible for providing or affirming Consent. Can be omitted if the referred entity is identical to the Data Subject.

description.en: Moment when this stage of the Consent was created.

usage.en: To be updated when the Consent Status changes.

description.en: Indicates the use or applicability of a Notice for the specified context.
Location where this stage of the Consent was created.

usage.en: To be updated when the Consent Status changes.

description.en: Indicates information about the Duration of the Consent.

usage.en: For example to indicate how long the Consent is valid (eg 6 months), or until what time (eg 31 december 2022) or until which event (eg account closure).

description.en: Indicates the association of the Consent with a Data Subject.
Specifies the state or status of consent.

usage.en: Examples are: ConsentRequested, Con,sentGiven, ConsentWithdrawn etc.

description.en: A Notice for information provision associated with Consent.

usage.en: This is to inform the Data Subject before Consent can be obtained. To be substituted by String, URL, Document referencing the actual Notice.

description.en: The individual or organisation that decides (or controls) the purpose(s) of processing the Personal Data.

usage.en: The terms 'Controller' is usually the more common form of indicating a Data Controller. In ISO/IEC the term 'PII Controller' is used.

description.en: A 'processor' means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which processes personal data on behalf of the Data Controller.
The individual (or category of individuals) whose Personal Data is being processed.

usage.en: The term 'data subject' is specific to the GDPR, but is functionally equivalent to the term 'individual' and the ISO/IEC term 'PII Principle'. REMARK: Can also be instantiated as a category, eg Personal Data Handling 123 for Data Subject(s) of type Customer.

description.en: Type of Data Subject.

usage.en: For example age-based types like Adult, Child or domain-based types like Patient, Employee ore jurisdictional roles like Citizen, Immigrant.

description.en: A human or non-human 'thing' that constitutes as an entity.

usage.en: To be used as an abstract superclass and to be substituted by an Agent like a Person or Organisation and/or a LegalEntity like a Data Subject, Data Controller etc.

description.en: Indicates the relation between specified Entity and Data Subject.

usage.en: Typically to be used in case of Consent by delagation, ie to specify that the Entity that indicated the Consent is related to the Data Subject. The kind of relationship is implied by the types of Data Subject and Entity (typically Child and Parent/Guardian of Data Subject respectively).

description.en: The Legal basis used to justify the Processing of the Personal Data.

usage.en: REMARK: DPV is based on the GDPR which is a European law but it allows to specify other laws or jurisdictions if applicable. This possibility is omitted for this application profile which is therefore only applicable in a European context. Also, this application profile focusses on one kind of Legal Basis, namely Consent. REMARK: DPV provides the possiblity to use Legal Basis as a category, eg the Legal Basis of Personal Data Handling 123 is Consent.

description.en: Indicates the association with the Personal Data Handling.
A human or non-human 'thing' that constitutes as an entity and which is recognised and defined in law.

usage.en: Superclass of entities like Data Subject, Data Controller etc, ie roles with legal importance in the GDPR.

description.en: Data directly or indirectly associated or related to an individual.

usage.en: This definition of personal data encompasses the concepts used in GDPR Art.4-1 for 'personal data' and ISO/IEC 2700 for 'personally identifiable information (PII)'.

description.en: TODO
Type of Personal Data.

usage.en: Examples from the DPV codelist are based on the source of the data (like Derived, Inferred, Observed) or on their sensitivity or other. REMARK: More thematic categories can be found in the DPV Extended Personal Data concepts codelist.

description.en: A high-level Class to describe 'data handling'. This can consist of Personal Data being processed for a Purpose, involving Entities, using Technical and Organisational Measures, applicable Risks, Rights, and Legal Basis.

usage.en: REMARK: DPV uses the term 'data handling' to distinguish between the general meaning of processing (collect Personal Data from Data Subject 123 by Data Controller 456 for the Purpose of marketing) versus the operations pereformed with the data (eg consult, shareÂ… ).

description.en: Indicates use or applicability of Technical or Organisational measure.

usage.en: Refers to the type of the Technical or Organisational measure that has been taken to protect the the Personal Data that is handled. Examples of Technical Measures are Anonymisation, Encryption, Web Security Protocols. Organisational Measures could be measures like Consent Notices, Privacy Notices, Credential Management.

description.en: Indicates the applicability of a Risk associated with the Personal data Handling.
Indicates the use or applicability of a Right with the Personal data Handling.
Indicates the Recipient of the Personal Data.
Indicates the association with the Purpose.

usage.en: Refers to the type of Purpose, ie the rerson or justification for the data handling. Examples in the context of Consent are Marketing, Personalised Advertising, Commercial research.

description.en: Indicates the association with the Processing.

usage.en: Refers to the type of Processing, ie the kind of operation that is performed  on the Personal Data. Examples are Collect, Disclose, Share.

description.en: Indicates the association with the Personal Data.
Indicates the use or applicability of a Legal Basis.
Indicates the association with the Data Subject.
Indiciates the inclusion or applicability of a Data Processor.
Indicates the association with the Data Controller.
The processing performed on the Personal Data.
Indicates information about the storage of the Personal Data.
Type of Processing.

usage.en: Refers to the type of Processing, ie the kind of operation that is performed  on the Personal Data. Examples are Collect, Disclose, Share.

description.en: The purpose of processing the Personal Data.
Type of Purpose.

usage.en: Refers to the type of Purpose, ie the reason or justification for the Personal Data Handling. Examples in the context of Consent are Marketing, Personalised Advertising, Commercial research.

description.en: Entitiy that receives the Personal Data.

usage.en: A Recipient of Personal Data can be used to indicate any Entity that receivesl the data. This can be a Third Party, Processor (GDPR), or even a Controller.

description.en: The right(s) applicable, provided, or expected.

usage.en: A 'right' is a legal, social, or ethical principle of freedom or entitlement which dictates the norms regarding what is allowed or owed. Rights as a concept encompass a broad area of norms and entities, and are not specific to individuals or Data Protection / Privacy. REMARK: For individual specific rights, see DPV:DataSubjectRight and EU Fundamental Rights.

description.en: A risk or possibility or uncertainty of negative effects, impacts, or consequences.

usage.en: Risks can be associated with one or more different concepts such as Purpose, Processing, Personal Data, Technical or Organisational Measures. REMARK: More info on this class in DPV-Risk.

description.en: Conditions required or followed regarding storage of data.

usage.en: When the type of Processing is 'store', subclasses of this abstract class allow to specify duration, location etc of the storage.

description.en: Duration or temporal limitation on the storage of the Personal Data.
Indicates information about the Duration of the storage.

usage.en: For example to indicate how long the Data is stored (eg 6 months), or until what time (eg 31 december 2022) or until which event (eg account closure).

description.en: Information used to uniquely identify of an object.

usage.en: The basic principle here is that this string is assigned by an organisation and that this is done according to a well-defined system.

description.en: Name of the Agent that issued the identifier.
String used to uniquely identify the object.

usage.en: The type of the string refers to the identification system (including its version), the string itself refers to the actual identifier.

description.en: The date on which the identifier was issued.
Link to the Agent that issued the identifier.

A location can be an identifiable geographic place (ISO 19112), but it can also be a non-geographic place such as a directory, row, or column. As such, there are numerous ways in which location can be expressed, such as by a coordinate, address, landmark, and so forth.
The duration or temporal limitation.

usage.en: REMARK: The details of this class can be provided by using the Time Ontology according to the type of Duration. Eg, if the type is DPV:TemporalDuration, adding as an additional type OWL-TIME:TemporalEntity and its attribute hasXSDDuration with datatype XSD:duration.

description.en: Type of Duration

usage.en: Examples are Temporal Duration (eg 6 months), Unitil Time Duration (eg till 31 december 2022), Until Event Duration (eg until account closure).
